episode_title: 214 - The One With the Prom Video
note: NOTE: For this episode, I’m using italics to signify portions contained in the prom video.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler is playing foosball by himself, Joey enters

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey. Hold on a second. [shoots a goal] Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice, nice. Hey I got somethin’ for you. [hands Chandler an envelope.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eight hundred and twelve bucks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t know what Big Leon told ya but it’s an even thousand if you want me for the whole night. What is this for?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m makin money now and this is payin’ you back for head shots, electric bills, and so many slices of pizza I can’t even count. I love ya man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, thanks man. Now I can get my pony.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, this is a little extra somethin’ for uh, ya know, always bein’ there for me. [hands Chandler a jewelry box]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, I don’t know what to say. [opens the box and pulls out an incredibly gaudy gold bracelet] Wow, I, I don’t know what to say.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heh, what d’ya say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. It’s a bracelet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Isn’t it? And it’s engraved too, check it out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [reads] To my best bud. [puts it back in the case] Thanks best bud.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Put it on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, now? [puts it in his desk drawer] No, no, I think something this nice should be saved for a special occasion. [sets a chair in front of the drawer]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, no no, that’s the beauty part, it goes with everything. [gets the bracelet from the drawer] You put this on, you’re good to go. [puts the bracelet on Chandler] Ohhh man, you are so wearin’ that bracelet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I so am.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You have any idea what this’ll do for your sex life?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’ll probably slow it down at first but, once I get used to the extra weight, I’ll be back on track.

content.description: A kitchen somewhere. Monica is interviewing for a job

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Well, this all looks good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: And if I want to call for a reference on your last job?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s there on the bottom, see the manager, Chandler Bing.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Alright, lets see if you’re as good in person as you are on paper. Make me a salad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A salad? Really I, I could do something a little more complicated if you like.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: No, just a salad will be fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You got it.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Now, I want you to tell me what you’re doing while you’re doing it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, well I’m tearing the lettuce.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Uh-huh. Is it dirty?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-oh, no no don’t worry, I’m gonna wash it.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Don’t, I like it dirty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s your call.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: So, uh, what are you going to do next?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Are they, uh, firm?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’r alright.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: You sure they haven’t gone bad? You’re sure they’re not very, very bad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No really, they’re OK.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: You gonna slice them up real nice?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Aaaahhhhhhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m outa here. [Monica leaves]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting at the couch. Ross is sitting at the table and answers the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y-ello. No, Rachel’s not here right now, can I take a message? Alright, and how do we spell Casey, is it like at the bat or and the Sunshine Band? OK, bye-bye. Hey, who’s this uh, this Casey?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, some guy she met at the movies.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh really? What uh, what does he want with her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m guessing he wants to do a little dance… ya know, make a little love… well pretty much get down tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [puts the message in the cupboard] I don’t know, I don’t get, I don’t get it, I mean, wh, wh, two months ago Rachel and I were like, this close. Right now, what, I’m takin messages from guys she, she meets at the movies? I mean this, this Casey should be takin’ down my messages, ya know, or, or, Rachel and I should be together and, and we should get some kind of me, message service.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hang in there, it’s gonna happen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha, OK, now how do you know that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because she’s your lobster.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, she’s goin’ somewhere.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: C’mon you guys. It’s a known fact that lobsters fall in love and mate for life. You know what, you can actually see old lobster couples walkin’ around their tank, ya know, holding claws like…
[Monica enters from bathroom after taking a shower]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you feelin’ better?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I think that fifth shower actually got the interview off me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, do you have any other possibilities?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, well there’s the possibility that I won’t make rent.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, if you want, I can lend you some money.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No no no, if I couldn’t pay you back right away then I’d feel guilty and tense every time I saw you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh OK. Well then why don’t you, uhh, why don’t you borrow it from mom and dad? You feel guilty and tense around them already. You might as well make some money off of them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know, the man’s got a point. [gestures with his arm and the bracelet falls off]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is that sparkly thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That thing, it’s a uhh… yeah it’s, it’s a little flashy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no, no no, it’s not flashy, not for a Goodfella.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man, man that is sharp. It must have cost you quite a few debloons.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica answers the door and lets her parents in. They are carrying boxes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Hi darling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, what’s this.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Some of your old stuff.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well sweetie, we have a surprise for you. We’re turning your room into a gym.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, that is a surprise. Just one little question, uh, why not Ross’s room?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Gosh, we talked about that but your brother has so many science trophies and plaques and merit badges, well we didn’t want to disturb them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, God forbid.
[Rachel enters with a laundry basket]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, hi Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, we were so sorry to hear about your parents splitting up, dear.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, you know, they’re just separated so, you know, never know, we’ll see.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, I can’t say any of us were surprised. Your parents have been unhappy ever since we’ve known them. Especially after that incident in Hawaii.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, what incident?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Uhh, naa, no no no, I, I must be thinking of someone else, uh, maybe me. Don’t you have some folding to do? Go fold dear. Fold. You fold. [shuffles her into her room]

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting on couches. A beautiful woman is looking at Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you want a refill?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I’m alright, thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. Ooh, OK, you gotta give me a second, I wanna get this just right. [she sticks out her gut, clears her throat and sniffs her nose and then in her best male voice…] Dude, 11 o’clock, totally hot babe checkin’ you out. That was really good, I think I’m ready for my penis now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [walks over to the woman] I know what you’re thinking, Dave Thomas, founder of Wendy’s.

content.speaker: Gail
content.text: I’m Gail.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Chandler. [waves his arm around, exposing the bracelet]

content.speaker: Gail
content.text: I, I really have to be somewhere but it was nice meeting you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? [realizes it was the bracelet] Oh this is excellent. You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller, the eyesore from the Liberace house of crap.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not that bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don’t have to walk around sporting some reject from the Mr. T collection. [Joey walks in behind Chandler]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity the fool that… [turns around and sees Joey] Hi. Hey man, we were just doin’ some uhh, impressions over here. Do your Marcel Marceau. [Joey turns around and walks out without saying anything] That’s actually good.

content.description: Central Perk. Rachel is talking to a man at the counter. Ross and Phoebe are sitting at the couches.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Would you look at that guy, I mean how long has he been talking to her. It’s like, back off buddy she’s a waitress not a geisha.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think she’s OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [Rachel, laughing, puts a hand on the guy’s shoulder] Look at that, look at that, see how she’s pushing him away and he won’t budge. Alright, I’m gonna do something. [walks up in the middle of their conversation] Excuse me, are you Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m Ross Geller. Wha, I’m, God in your add you said you were pretty but wow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you, what are you doin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh my God, is this the wrong day? I don’t believe it, uh, well, hey, I guess if it works out we’ll, we’ll have something to tell the grandkids.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Sure will. I’ve uh, gotta go. Take care.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, see ya later, nice meeting you. [man leaves] You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was saving you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Saving, saving, saving me from the pleasant conversation with the interesting man, saving me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, see from where I was sitting I uh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, Ross, listen to me, I am not yours to save.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But, you are.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, uh, well you’re, umm, you’re my lobster.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, you know what, are, are you being like, the blind date guy again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no, you’re uh, you’re my lobster. See um, lobsters, uhh, in the tank when, when they’re old, uhh, they get with, uhh, they walk around holding the claws. In the tank, ya know, with, with the holding and… Uhh, Phoebs you wanna help me out with the, the whole lobster thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do the claws again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach. OK, forget, forget the lobsters OK. We’re, let’s talk, what about us?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, there is no us, OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, listen to me. I fell for you and I get clobbered. You then fall for me and I again, somehow, get clobbered. I’m tired of being clobbered, ya know, it’s, it’s just not worth it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, but, but…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: NO but Ross. We are never gonna happen, OK. Accept that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: E-except, except that what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, ACC-cept that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler is there. Joey enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey man, look it’s my best bud. How ya doin? [Joey doesn’t respond] Wow, you are really gettin’ good at that Marcel Marceau thing. Hey, whaddya say uh, we play some ball, you and me, huh, whaddya say? [Throws a basketball to Joey. Joey doesn’t move to catch it and the ball takes out a lamp] OK, that’s my bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you hated the bracelet so much, Chandler, you should have just said so.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, doesn’t the fact that I wore the bracelet even though I hated it say something about our friendship and how much it means to me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what about the fact that you insulted the bracelet and you made fun of me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, well that’s the part where I’m a wank. But I was hoping we wouldn’t focus on that. [Joey goes to his room and shuts the door] Hey, c’mon man, I said I was sorry like a hundred times, I promise I will never take it off my… [notices the bracelet is missing from his wrist] wrist. But if, if you want to stay in there and be mad, you know, you just uh, you stay in there. [he starts searching the room, lifting up the couch cushions]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what the… [sees Chandler on his knees, holding the couch cushions]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am here, on my knees, holding up these couch cushions as a symbol of my sorrow and regret, much like they did in biblical times. Though you may haveth anger now… [Joey returns to his room]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Mr. and Mrs. Geller are watching tennis on TV, Monica is sitting at the table

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You know, that Steffi Graf has quite a tush. I’m just saying, it’s right there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Hi, darling. Where’s my grandson, you didn’t bring him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, he’s at uh, Carol’s and Susan’s today.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: A woman in my office is a lesiban. I’m just saying.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, Jack look, there’s that house paint commercial that cracks you up. [the Gellers return to watching TV and Ross goes over to Monica]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where have you been?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emotional hell. So, did they lend you the money yet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, but that’s probably ’cause I haven’t asked them yet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon Monica, do it. Hey, you guys, um, Monica has some news.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, yeah, so uh, uhh, listen, I’m sorry I didn’t tell you this before but umm, I, I’m no longer at my job, I, I had to leave it.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because they made me.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You were fired? What’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Judy, Judy, relax, this is our little harmonica we’re talking about. We taught her well. Ten percent of your paycheck, where does it go?

content.speaker: Monica & Ross
content.text: In the bank.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: There you go. So she dips into her savings, that’s what it’s there for. She’s gonna be fine, and if you need a little extra, you know where to find it. [pulls a quarter from behind her ear]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anything larger back there?

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler and Phoebe enter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would you stop already? Get out of the bitter barn and play in the hay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you’re right I, I should play in the hay. Forget about the fact that I just dropped 400 dollars to replace a bracelet that I hated to begin with. Bring on the hay. [sits down at the bar]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [comes up from behind the bar and startles Chandler] Hey. I’ve got something that’s gonna make you happy. Guess what Gunther found? [holds up Chandler’s bracelet]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey now you have two. [Chandler looks annoyed] Oh, now you have two.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What am I gonna do, huh? [Joey walks in behind him]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How come you have two?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well this one’s for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I can’t. No no, listen, I, I know how much this means to you and I also know that this is about more than just jewelry, [puts bracelet on Joey] it’s about you and me and the fact that we’re [reading bracelet] best buds.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, is this friendship? I think so. Check it out, we’re bracelet buddies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what they’ll call us.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Ross are standing in the kitchen. Ross is filling out a check

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here you go, you can pay me back whenever you like.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have dinosaur checks?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah I mean, you get your money and you learn a little something, what’s wrong with that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothin’, nothin’, hey you’re a cheapasaurus. I’m kidding, I’m kidding, thank you, I’m very greatful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [Standing in living room with Chandler and Joey. She pulls a huge bathing suit out of a box] Hey, Mon, what is this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, um, that was my bathing suit from high school. I was uh, a little bigger then.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I thought that’s what they used to cover Connecticut when it rained.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [pulls out a VCR tape] Hey Monica, what’s on this video tape?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, you got me, put it in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [Rachel enters] Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Over here Jack. OK. I see, Rachel’s coming up the path. Oh doesn’t she look pretty. Jack, get this. [Rachel enters with a huge nose]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is with your nose?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They had to reduce it because of, of my deviated septum.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, I was wrong, that’s what they used to cover Connecticut.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what this is, this is us getting ready for the prom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, you guys, we don’t have to watch this.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah we do. C’mon.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Get a shot of Monica. Where’s Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Over here dad. [he pans over and we see a torso taking up the whole screen]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Wait, how do you zoom out? [zooms out and we see an extremely overweight Monica eating a big sandwich] There she is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Some girl ate Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up, the camera adds ten pounds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, so how many cameras are actually on you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you look so great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh, so do you, beautiful. [they hug]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oops.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shoot, I think I got mayonaise on you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that’s OK, it’s just the shoulder, it’s not my dress.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Everybody smile.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, dad, turn it off.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It is off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad, it is not. What’s with the red light?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It’s the off light. Right Ross? [pans over to see Ross with an afro and moustache]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Lookin’ good Mr. Cotter.
Ross: You look pretty tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thanks. So, uh, what are you gonna do this summer?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you know, I’m just gonna, I’m gonna hang out, work on my music.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [the shoulders of her dress keep falling off her shoulders] Is my hook unhooked? These things keep falling down, I can’t…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, hold, let me see, I don’t know. So what’re you gonna do… [doorbell rings]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, the guys are here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: this summer?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Work on your music?
[Ross is sitting on the stairs with a laptop keyboard playing ‘Axel-F’]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, look there’s Roy Gublik.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ya know, Roy saw Star Wars 317 times. His name was in the paper.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where’s Chip, why isn’t he here yet?

content.speaker: Roy
content.text: He’ll be here OK, take a chill pill. [Chip pins Monica’s corsage on, Monica then turns and whispers to Rachel]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just told Rachel that Roy touched my boob.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t go to my own prom without a date, I can’t, it’s too late.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you’re not going then I don’t want to go either.

content.speaker: Roy
content.text: Oh, I’m gonna kick Chip’s ass.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: [to Ross on the stairs] I have a wonderful idea. You should take Rachel to the prom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Doubtful.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack, give me that. Talk to your son.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Your mother’s right. Take her, you can wear my tux.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, she won’t want to go with me.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Of course she would, you’re a college man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, c’mon. Don’t ya want to find out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe I don’t get to go to my own prom, this is so harsh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK. Hold my board.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Atta boy. [Ross scrambles upstairs to change]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, you guys, ya know, I think we’ve seen enough, let’s turn it off.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No, no, no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, fine, well I’m not gonna watch, alright.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon kid, let’s go.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ahh, are you hadsome.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Let’s show ’em.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, just a sec dad. [to himself] OK, be cool, just be cool. [walks down the stairs and grabs the flowers out of the vase on the endtable] OK dad.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: [going downstairs] Rachel, ready or not, here comes your knight in shining… oh no. [Chip has shown up and the four are leaving]

content.speaker: Rachel, Monica, Roy, and Chip
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, dear. Jack, how do I turn this off?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Press the button.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Which one? Which button, Jack.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: The button, the button.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you did that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well.
[Rachel, seeing what he did for her, gets up, walks across the room, and kisses Ross]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, he’s her lobster.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica is watching the rest of the tape

content.text: Mrs. Geller: Dance with him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom, I’m hungry.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Dance with your father.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I may not know any of your flash dances but I’m no slouch on the dance floor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright.
[the tape cuts to Monica’s parents under the covers]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, Jack.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh, Judy. Oh, Judy.

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Oh, ohhhhh.
[Monica is visibly upset]
